```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
```

```{R}

#lets learn some ways of calculatng correlation.
X=c(1,2,3,4,5,6)
X

Y=c(2,3,4,6,8,10)
Y

#Lets plot x and y and see how they fit into a line, this will give a basic idea of how they are correlated (or not)
plot(X,Y, pch=16)

#Let's compute the linear correlation coefficient
cor(X,Y)


#Distance between two numbers. lets use same x and y.
dist(cbind(X,Y))

#Let's manually compute the euclidean distance
L2=sqrt(sum((X-Y)^2))
L2
```
